likelihood_impact_change.explanation: Under the 'Delayed Transition' scenario, the likelihood of biodiversity loss impacting resource availability for the Mac Division increases due to higher ecosystem degradation (0.4) and biodiversity loss metrics (0.3) associated with a temperature increase of 2.5 degrees. This results in a greater strain on sourcing materials required for Mac products, thereby increasing both likelihood and impact.

emerging_opportunities.description: The Mac Division can explore the development of sustainable materials and eco-friendly products to address growing consumer demand for environmentally friendly technology.
Implementing recycling and refurbishment programs could enhance brand loyalty and reduce reliance on raw materials, mitigating risks associated with biodiversity loss.

additional_challenges.description: Increased biodiversity loss may lead to resource scarcity, impacting the supply chain for critical components of Mac products.
Stricter regulations aimed at preserving biodiversity could impose additional compliance costs and operational challenges for the Mac Division.

mitigation_strategies.description: Develop and implement a policy that prioritizes the sourcing of materials from suppliers that adhere to biodiversity-friendly practices.

mitigation_strategies.strategy: Investment in R&D for Alternative Materials
mitigation_strategies.description: Invest in research and development to find alternative materials that are less reliant on biodiversity-sensitive resources.
Partner with NGOs and environmental organizations to promote biodiversity conservation efforts and contribute to sustainable practices.
